question: Looking at the sales performance heatmap, which statement best describes the relationship between North's Q1 sales and South's Q1 sales?

options.A: It can be inferred that their sales performances are very similar.
options.B: The sales performances might be significantly different, but the discrete color bins make them appear more different than they actually are.
options.C: North is clearly better than South, and the color difference accurately represents this sales gap.
options.D: The sales performance difference among different locations is impossible to determine from this visualization.

explanation: North (180.2) and South (120.3) have a 59.9-point difference in Q1 sales, but the categorical color encoding groups them into the same color bin (100-200 range), masking their actual difference.
